tldr: The author, Signior Fracassati, conducted experiments injecting various liquids into the veins of animals. He observed the effects of Aqua fortis diluted, spirit of Vitriol, and Oil of Sulphur on the animals' blood and behavior. The experiments suggested that both coagulation and excessive fluidity of the blood can cause death. The author proposed that this knowledge could be used to treat apoplexy and improve dissection techniques.
